Dr. Heater 240 Volt 5600 Watt Garage Workshop Portable Industrial Space Heater
column4: ['This does all I need for taking the chill off our two bay shop at "Coop\'s Miata" in Maple Valley Washington.It is quiet and efficient. The only negative thing is the short chord and the odd plug. I had to make a 20 ft extension chord with adaptation for my shop 240 service. Ended up changing the plug on the heater chord as well.  Couldn\'t find a chord female plug for this style. Worked out that I ended up using the same mail plug I use for my Tig. Word of caution: use the right gauge wire and keep it less than 25 feet.', "I purchased this heater in 01/2013 to replace a propane bottle heater.  It is much safer than propane and the fan circulates the heat.  I have been extremely happy with this heater as it has worked great to heat my insulated garage/shop during the cold N. IL winters.  I gave it four stars due to the fact that the fan motor uses sleeve bearings and not ball so any dirt that accumulates on the blades causes vibration and wear on the bearings.  It is important to keep the fan blades clean to reduce wear and extend the life.  I suggest cleaning every season.  I just completed cleaning blades and fan bearings and the heater works like new again.  Very easy to do with just a few screws to remove cover and fan  Don't get me wrong this is a great heater for the price.  I will look into the model 966 which has a heavier duty fan when this wears out. ", "Don't get me wrong they put out heat... But not like people brag about on them... If your in a two bay garage it will take the chill out in roughly in a hour with the door closed. Lots of 220 power used in an hr. If you put it beside you when working on a car in the open it cycles off and on the heating element a lot as if room temperature has been reached. Cold hot cold hot.... Wasn't worth adding a 220 outlet. Says industrial use only on the warning label on top, exactly what industry would have been nice to know... Because  commercial mechanic work does not qualify....", "I spent almost a couple hours reading and researching several heaters to help for winter work in the garage. My final decision in this unit was the power of the fan. It was much stronger BLOWER MOTOR than many others. It is built tough/rugged like (old school box style construction). I figured with the amount of electricity this draws and the fan strength, I'd get e bit more bang for the buck. I was wrong... I've seen more impressive 110 models in the past over this. Unfortunate results for the amount of electricity you pour out. It also has a horrible cool draft off one corner. How does a heater blow a cool breeze with the hot? (Maybe the blower is to strong for the heating element?) Even standing in front of this unit, It was not impressive on the heat being generated. If you don't care about electricity and need to blow a little bit of heat a distance then I would suggest this unit for you.... everyone else, I suggest researching other units.", 'When I received this heater the box was in perfect shape, no signs of damage, but when I opened it and pulled the heater out the fan was laying in the bottom not attached to the bracket inside. Pulled the cover off and screws totally missing, fan and inside of heater looked as if it had been running with the fan hitting inside of housing. Screws not inside the heater nor in the box. Got the fan straightened out and bought screws from hardware store, remounted fan and turned the heater on. It started working and seemed to be okay. The heater coil is not suppose to turn red while it is running however on day 2 the coil is starting to turn red while heating so the coil is not going to last very long before it shorts out. This was a waste of money, and a waste of time to work on it to get it running. If I had just wanted a fan I could have bought several fans from Walmart for what this cost.', "Using on construction site.  Keeps 3 bedroom townhouses at 70 degrees.Bought 15 open box and 1 new.  Could not tell the difference.  One heater had a loose fan bracket.Tightened screws and it was good.  Another heater had a fan that rattled. Had some play on the drive shaft.  Added a washer and it was good as new.  Can't complain because they were 1/2 the price of new ones.  Wish they had a different plug.  A dryer or range end would be better.", 'This is to backup the same model in use for a couple years, they work very well. Only complaint is new one has a high pitched fan motor whine when the unit is not under a heat load with just the fan running.  ', 'An excellent buy. Good strong heat for  an old 20 x 20 wood garage with a high peak ceiling, and no insulation in very cold weather. Had to change the 30 amp 220v electrical receptacle, but that was it. Leave it on the floor, and it will do a good job.', 'Dr Infrared heater will work in a 600 foot building if it is insulated and dry walled temp 40F outdoors will stay 70-75 indoors easy I have a Gas heater , and use the Dr heater with it when it is 20 outdoors and keep it 70 indoors the Dr heat will turn on and off my gas keeps going . the last to days I left the gas go all night when I get to the Shop I turn dr heat on and turn the gas off from 7am to 5 pm the temp never got under 75 , it was 32 outdoors and got to 48 outdoors and I can turn Dr heater up or down to regulate the shop temp . Only had Dr heater 10 days . Its been a lot of help so far .', "Good heater at a good price.  Bought this one to replace the same heater I've had for a couple of years.  Only complaint I have is that this heater does not come with a parts list for ordering replacement parts.  My previous heater had the control (rheostat?) go bad, and I couldn't find what part I needed to replace it."]

column1: Mr. Heater MH9BX 9000 BTU Propane Portable Buddy Heater - FREE Shipping
column4: ["I bought this heater for my small garage workshop. My electric heater kept tripping the breaker while using other equipment. I was afraid of other gas heaters due to their carbon monoxide emissions. This was one of the few gas heaters rated for indoor use. It also has an oxygen depletion detector and tip over cut off feature which I thought was very important.This heater silently keeps my shop warm in even the coldest temperatures and can also be attached to a 20 pound propane tank with an accessory hose ~ which I also purchased. I've run this heater for up to 6 hours uninterrupted with no noticeable fumes and since all the heat is focused out the front, it can be set close to a wall with no worries.I know I'm going to get a lot of use out of this heater. It was a very reasonable price and filled my needs perfectly. Highly recomend the Mr. Heater Buddy for heating small spaces.", 'Here in Monterey County the weather can be colder in the evenings. At my home we cut of the central heating back in ‚Äò88 so we all dress up like eskimos to keep warm. Don‚Äôt get me wrong. We do use electric heaters in certain areas but after purchasing this Portable Propane heater, it was Heaven sent. I recommend this product with all my heart. It is compact. It is durable. It is easy to refuel. It is warm to hot. And now, as we speak, the 5 ft extension hose just arrived. When connected from my Gas Buddy to a 20 lb propane tank, I should get at least 24 hrs of constant heat. Thank you for your time. ', 'The last power outage we only had kerosene heaters.  They are big, bulky, heavy, require pouring fuel and the fumes left us wheezing and coughing.  Therefore, we found these Mr. Heater, bought two and what a difference.  Small enough to be moved from room to room and so much safer.  You will love Mr Heater.', "Small and practical for portable heat when equipped with a disposable bottle, it's even great for a more permanent heat source - just pair this heater up with a hose and a large refillable propane bottle.  It even has a pilot light for easy on and off use.  Two heat settings, 4000 and 9000 BTUs.  The back of the heater stays cool to the touch, so it can be used backed against a wall.  Six stars for this heater.", 'Really nice heater. Relatively easy to operate and has safety features. Heater will not run all night, though with the small propane cylinders. ', "Love this portable propane heater. Can't wait to take it camping. In the meantime, we use it around the house to warm up and enjoy the heat it produces. If the power goes out, we will stay warm with this heater!", "This is a very good product.  What is different about Mr. Heater compared to other small heaters is that it uses 1 lb. propane tanks, thus it does not have to be plugged in or placed near an electrical outlet.  It is easy to use and have a anti tip safety feature that will cut the unit off if the unit is tipped.  Keep on hand a few 1 lb. propane cylinders, and you're good to go.  Very good heater for small spaces and can be used indoors.", 'Great propane heater with 2 settings. I also bought a 12ft hose to connect to a 5 Gallon propane tank. The low setting was enough to warm my 29ft motor home. Perfect.', 'Purchased the additional Mr. Heater 10\' hose (item F273704) that you don\'t have to use a filter and connected it to a 20 lb. bottle of propane.   Easy to light and ran all night on low to keep my greenhouse warm.  I used a 1.5" PVC water pipe and ran the pipe under the foundation of my greenhouse and then ran the hose through it outside where the tank was located.  For safety reasons, you aren\'t supposed to have the 20 lb. tank inside near the heater.  I cut up an old wash cloth and stuck it inside the pvc pipe to keep bugs and cold air from entering into my greenhouse. So easy to do.  ', 'Product operates exactly as advertised, which nowadays is not always the case. It functions easily and simply. Really like the option to go to larger capacity tank for longer use periods or not having to change out bottles constantly.']

column1: LifeSmart 3 Element 1500W Quartz Infrared Electric Portable Room Space Heater
column4: ["Bought this heater for our main bathroom which isn't used all that often, although when we had our master bathroom remodeled it's all we used. It performs flawlessly. Easy to use and we really enjoy the wireless remote, this convenient feature makes it so easy to regulate, and one of the nicest features of this heater is it heats up very quickly. The digital read outs are also easy to see. And when my spouse uses the controls manually, she has no problems, she also feels it was easy to use and regulate controls. We kept it low until we actually had to use it, and I'm on a walker, so my spouse would go ahead of me, when our master bathroom was being remodeled and turn the heat up a little for my comfort! Now that's priceless! She's an angel too! There's no down-side to owning this heater. It's small enough to be out of the way, and powerful enough to heat like a much bigger heater. It has wheels hidden underneath the carriage, moves in any direction with ease. This is a good all around heater. We have this one and a larger one we use in our master bedroom, and we've owned them for over six months and they both work very nice. And we've notice our heat bill went down almost thirty dollars one month, and we believe these heaters AND having the central house heat turned down lower is the reason. This is in our opinion an all around nice and economical product.", "I bought this to heat a good sized bedroom. I had an edenpure which worked good but only lasted 2 years. This unit heats my bedroom to 70 no problem. The fan is slightly loud but tolerable. The buttons make a loud beep when pressed so not great if u want to change temp in the middle of the night when the wife is sleeping. It has made little effect on the electric bill. I can't speak to how long it will last bc we have only had it around 3 months but for its compact size it works great and a quarter of the price of the Eden pure", 'It is winter in Colorado. I have to clean the double car garage, since we are moving.This little heater is great. It heats about an 8 ft area, fighting against the 20 degree cold. It warms enough space for me to pack up the workbench and to move it onto the shelving area.My only complaint is the cord is not very long, I had to dig out the extension cord, then remember not to trip over the extension cord!  I did not notice a significant added cost to my electric bill when I was using it.', 'I purchased the heater because it put out air close to the floor as opposed to similar heaters that push air toward the ceiling.  It warms my living room well on the efficiency setting.  I have not been able to actually determined the electricity usage, but with three heat levels it can be regulated.  It is also small and easy to move to any area where extra heat is needed.  I would recommend this product for the price and quality in this heater.  The remote allows you to change the temperature or turn off the heater from the comfort of your chair and with the heat coming out at floor level, the entire room heats more efficiently.', 'I purchased this to use in our downstairs bathroom to keep my wife and I warm on those cold mornings. It works great. We have always used some kind of space heater but never been able to stay warm as we like it. The LifeSmart heater is great!', 'Nice spot heater for exceptionally cold days here in New England. Well-designed and manufactured. Requires no maintenance. Easy to use remote or front panel controls. Less conspicuous, smaller case than clunky wood-covered heaters, but same performance. column4: ['I have a ceramic heater but this is a REAL HEATER!! It throws out a LOT of HEAT--on TWO settings...HIGH and low. This is the GREATEST. I had one before but it burned out. I fixed it 4 times but its finally dead. This one is a great replacement. ', 'LIghtweight, comfortable.   Perfect for warming up like a wood burning stove but no smoke! column1: Cozy Coop Poultry Heater Cold Weather Protection Flat Panel 200 Watts 120 VAC
column4: ["We have made a shelter in our garage for a feral cat that we have been feeding for quite a while. It comes into our garage and goes upstairs to an attic . This heater keeps the little shelter box warm and cozy. It works from radiant heat and does not get hot enough to burn anything so I don't have to be concerned about fires. It doesn't use a lot of electricity and works great!", 'I would not recommend this product for use in a coop. I bought it to use in a 4\'x6\'x3\' coop and it raised the inside temperature by approximately 10 degrees... not very helpful when the outside temperature averages 10 degrees or less all winter. I tried it in the house first and the temperature sticker (heat sensor) glowed after a few minutes. Once I put it outside, the sticker hasn\'t glowed at all and the chicken\'s water has frozen twice - despite being within inches of the heater. I\'m sure it would be fine for indoor brooding, or even in warmer climates, but if you live "up north" where winters are long & cold I would definitely look into something which produces significantly more heat.', "Great for a small indoor space with not a lot of movement of the air.  It doesn't put out a tremendous amount of heat and can actually be touched without any real discomfort. Would be great for a small chicken coop or a heated animal enclosure (like a dog or cat house) but the switch is not waterproof and neither is the heat panel, so avoid wet situations.", 'Warm safe indoor outdoor type of heater that uses little electricity and since it uses little energy it can also run on a small emergency inverter great peace of mind', 'I have no chickens.....I do have an old house that\'s a 100 years old.....Little drafty in a few places... And, I\'m loving these....The low cost to operate hardly taking any space at all to be used in and just taking a chill out of the air....Well my "Cock" is gonna be happy this Winter....', "easy to use, safe, and doesn't take up a lot of room.  It is however hot to the touch unlike it says!", 'Works great. Only draws 200 watts. Delivered quickly. Chickens love it.', 'Use it inside for my cockatiel. Note that the bird has to be pretty close (within 5-6 inches) to the for them to feel heat but I am very happy with it. It would work outside with my chickens if they needed it.', "I won't be running this heater all the time, but there are nights here that go below freezing. I've had chicken's combs freeze before, and it's not pretty. This will keep the coop above freezing, and solve the problem! It mounts on the wall, and it's easy to clean. GREAT product~~~", 'Amazed, after reading a couple other reviews, but mine arrived intact, and is working perfectly, in some really cold conditions.  I have it in a very small coop, but with -35 temps, it is keeping it fine for my girls!Very happy, so far....knock on wood!']

column1: RoadPro RPSL-681 12V Direct Hook-Up Ceramic Heater/Fan with Swivel Base & wit...
column4: [" As my house was damaged in a recent mudslide, I'm living in an insulated shed, and my power system consists of 6 golf cart batteries, an inverter and an inverter generator.  I ordered this item so that I could heat the shed without running the generator or inverter. As an electronic technician, I also disassembled it to see what quality it was, and how easy it would be to add a thermostat to it.  It's nicely made, has a good quality, quiet fan, and uses a relay to control the heater element, which means less wear and tear on it's control switch, and easy to modify for a thermostat.  It works well, and is quite adequate to get the 8x10 shed comfy when it's low 40s outside. I haven't modified it yet. Draws about 25amps. Heats up in a minute or two, and puts out a pleasant warm breeze. It's running as I type. Unlike a lot of those cheap window defroster units, it's a solid, well built product that will last, puts out a decent level of heat and doesn't sound like it's about to self-destruct any second like those cheap units.  Computer style fan should last for years..  Quite pleased with this product. ", "I purchase one of these becausenthey are advertised well. It seemed to be my best bet when the heat in my work truck went bad and I didn't have $1,000 at that time to fix it. We only had a few more weeks of winter left so I figured this would get me through. WRONG! First of all these couldn't warm a person up nor warm the passenger compartment of any vehicle even if left running for a week(seven(7) straight days). Not to mention after only three(3) times of turning it on in an attempt to lessen the cold ride to work the thing just completely pucked out on me. I decided to take it apart to see why the most expensive aftermarket 12v vehicle heater crapped out on me. Well simply put everythong about it was just cheap. The thin guage wires used in the internal workings of this heater I think are a hazard. They would never handle the current needed to warm the heating element. I'm very thankful that my mistake of purchasing this unit didn't end way worse. Because the sheer lack of quality is dangerous, it easily could have caught my truck on fire. Terrible quality! BEWARE - WARNING! SAVE YOUR MONEY - This heater is just like throwing cash in the trash can!", 'I use these units to heat my tractor cab. You definitely want to be sure you wire heavy enough to handle the load (#12). Then if you lose heat capability and you feel you have the ability, open it up and check the wiring where the power comes in. They have a tendency to unwire and that is an Achilles Heel. I had to beef up my last one and then it worked fine.', 'I bought this because the heater in my truck doesn\'t work. I used this heater exactly 3 times for a total less than 3 hours, and it burned up. The nasty stench of burning wires  and choking smoke filled the cab I had to pull over on a cold winter morning on the way to work and get out of the truck to get away from the nautiuos smell.. DON"T BUY THIS PIECE OF CRAP!  And I am being nice  calling it crap! ', "At first I was very happy with the heater.  My heater in my car wasn't working so I bought this as a temporary fix until I could get it repaired.  It was easy to hook up and warmed my car's interior quite well.  Then after a few days it stopped making any heat.  It now just blows cold air.", 'received heater on time,looked exactly as picture in ad,works ok so far,wish fan was stronger,but i am pleased overall', "Doesn't put out a lot of heat but does require a lot of power in it's attempt. column1: MR. HEATER Mr. Heater Buddy LP Fuel Filter F273699 Pack of 6
column4: ['This is the correct filter for using a hose with your Mr Heater. It filters oils that can come from the hose and any trash that might have found its way into hose. Arrived as advertised and ready to go.', "Those little 1 lb. cylinders are great but if you want to heat for longer than a couple hours you'll find buying a 20 lb. propane tank, a long supply hose and a regulator a must.  My old Mr. Buddys used to work without a regulator but the new one I got wouldn't even light the pilot light without the regulator.  At any rate, I'm sitting warm and Mr. Buddy is working.  Do yourself a favor - even if you don't regularly use a big tank with Mr Buddy having the regulator and hose will give you peace of mind knowing should you need heat for a longer time you've got everything you need to stay warm.  It turns your propane heater from something you can use occasionally to knock the chill off into a heater you can depend on in an emergency.", 'Fuel filter kit matched up with my Mr. Heater without any issues. Works great.', "I wish it weren't necessary to purchase these filters, because they are expensive and don't last particularly long.  However, they are absolutely necessary.  I learned the hard way with my first Mr. Buddy, which I ran with standard unfiltered propane canisters, which the Mr. Buddy is designed for.  In a season, the heater was hopelessly clogged and useless.  These filters will prevent that from happening.  The problem, unfortunately, is that, with the filters installed, standard canisters don't fit into the heater compartments that are designed to hold them.  The central promise of the Mr. Buddy‚Äîportability‚Äîis thus dead on arrival.", 'An excellent add-on to a Mr. Heater. Will keep the tiny orifice open and clear, if you are using a 20lbs propane tank. ', "Have had a Big Buddy for several years as my space heater in the winter. Have always had this filter installed for protection. The filters aren't cheap, but you must have them as a blockage and the cleaning process thereafter is a pain. That's the only reason they are a good value.", 'This product came very fast and it really improve my tent heat performance. Before, I had trouble with the heater. Was hard to start and very hard to keep pilot fire lit. After installing it the pilot heats up fast and stays lit. Nice product, I bought two of them. Not really a decorater item, so that idea is out.  Into the spares locker on the boat. column4: ["I already own multiple Vornado products including a VH103 I purchased in 2011 that I'm still using to this day.What I liked the most is that it uses mechanical (not electronic) switches. You have 3 rocker switches with a main power switch, heat low/high setting and fan setting). You also have a dial to enable fan only mode (to use year round) or auto. You can use this with a remote or smart outlet (15A rating).What I don't like- somewhat hard to clean. In my experience, cleaning is not for the faint of heart. It is built exactly like the VH103 such that you have to unscrew the unit completely to separate the front and back, then I used a shopvac to blow out the dust from the heating coils and a cloth to wipe down the fan blade and clean out the grille. I've done this about every 3 years.Most critical difference between this VH2 and the older VH103:- When in heat mode, the fan in the VH2 will cycle on/off when in auto when the temperature is reached. In the VH103, the fan will continue running to maintain airflow and circulation- The temperature dial on the VH2 goes from 1-7 while the VH103 goes from approx 65 - 90 degrees. I found it much easier to dial in my setting when I could set it against a temperature. With the VH2, you need to figure out what dial setting works for you.", 'This heater warms up my room quickly and the thermostat feature works well to maintain desired temperature. Auto-shutoff for tippage actually works! Would buy again, would recommend. ', "Pros:- Fast and efficient with small rooms. This heats up a small room within 15 minutes on high (1500W) at setting 4. Once warm, it can be switched to low (750W) and turned down by 1 to maintain temperature.- Small. Doesn't take a lot of space and is easy to move around.Cons:- Noisy. Makes a notable but tolerable hum when operating.- Cannot set a temperature. Numbers are for adjusting the run time, but you must experiment. column4: ['Even though it cost almost 1 1/2 One Pound Coleman tanks from 9pm to 5am,  it‚Äôs great. Keeps my whole RV toasty warm. ', 'This little buddy heater is a fine unit for use in an ice fishing shelter or flip over sled / tent.
